Posts.Content: That doesn’t sound good Karen I hope I can avoid that!!  I feel like I don’t have much luck lately! It was only in the summer I had a womb cancer scare! Turned out to be Endometrial Hyperplasia thankfully. Can’t be too careful these days, especially with breast cancer running so strongly in my family!  I can’t feel any lumps, but the pain feel very deep so if there’s anything there, even just a cyst, I suppose I wouldn’t be able to feel it! Keeping my fingers crossed xx
Posts.Title: Newbie here!

Posts.Content: Hello everyone!  I’m Megan, I’m 23 and have been referred to a breast clinic because of pain in my left breast.  Only got referred on Monday (23rd) and got a call today for an appointment with a consultant on Tuesday (31st!). Impressed with the speed! I’ve had pain for a few months now, it’s very sharp and takes my breath away. I had an angry red mark which the GP thought was a follicle infection so I was given antibiotics. It looks better but the pain feels very deep in the breast.  My main question was what to expect at the appointment? Will I have an ultrasound or mammogram? I’ve no idea! Breast cancer runs strongly in my family and so does the BRCA gene!! Thanks in advance xx
Posts.Title: Newbie here!

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying so quickly!  I don’t feel too worried at the moment and I hope I stay that way! A little apprehensive but I think that’s because it’s all new to me!  I do try to avoid google as well! Thank you for letting me know what to expect! Don’t like the sound of a biopsy! Is that painful? Hopefully just an ultrasound and mammogram for me!!  Thank you for the hug one is always welcomed!! Xx
Posts.Title: Newbie here!

Posts.Content: Well here’s hoping all I’ll need is a mammogram and ultrasound! Xx
Posts.Title: Newbie here!
